title: Notre Dame Reopens Five Years After Fire
content: The archbishop of Paris re-opened Notre Dame cathedral on Saturday by symbolically knocking on the doors and entering the 12th-century landmark which has been restored after a devastating fire in 2019.
summary: The archbishop of Paris re-opened Notre Dame cathedral on Saturday by symbolically knocking on the doors and entering the 12th-century landmark which has been restored after a devastating fire in 2019.

title: Syrian Rebels Say They Have Encircled Capital; Russia, Trump Weigh In
content: Rebels on a lightning advance through Syria said they were nearing the capital Damascus on Saturday, although the Bashar al-Assad government denied the army had withdrawn from areas around the city. The rebels claimed they had encircled the city.
summary: Rebels on a lightning advance through Syria said they were nearing the capital Damascus on Saturday, although the Bashar al-Assad government denied the army had withdrawn from areas around the city. The rebels claimed they had encircled the city.

title: 22 Terrorists, 6 Soldiers Killed During Security Operations In Pakistan
content: At least 22 terrorists were eliminated while six soldiers were killed during three separate operations over two days in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province in northwestern Pakistan, media wing of the army said on Saturday.
summary: At least 22 terrorists were eliminated while six soldiers were killed during three separate operations over two days in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province in northwestern Pakistan, media wing of the army said on Saturday.

title: Trump, Zelensky, Macron Discuss "Crazy" World In Paris
content: French President Emmanuel Macron on Saturday hosted three-way talks with Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky and Donald Trump, discussing what the American president-elect termed a world that was a "little crazy".
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron on Saturday hosted three-way talks with Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky and Donald Trump, discussing what the American president-elect termed a world that was a "little crazy".

title: Is The 'Writing On The Wall' For Syria's Bashar al-Assad?
content: More than 13 years since Bashar al-Assad's security forces opened fire on protesters demanding democratic reforms, the Syrian president's grip on power may finally be weakening.
summary: More than 13 years since Bashar al-Assad's security forces opened fire on protesters demanding democratic reforms, the Syrian president's grip on power may finally be weakening.

title: 'Needle Moving Towards Negotiation': S Jaishankar On Russia-Ukraine War
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar gave a stern reply to the 'criticism' on India's purchase of Russian oil, while strongly asserting that the world is realising the need to be at the negotiating table to resolve Russia-Ukraine conflict.
summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar gave a stern reply to the 'criticism' on India's purchase of Russian oil, while strongly asserting that the world is realising the need to be at the negotiating table to resolve Russia-Ukraine conflict.

title: US Man Kills Son, Burns Body Before Telling Cops "It Was Horrible Accident"
content: A lawyer in the United States allegedly shot his 20-year-old son, burnt his body and then called the cops to tell them what he claimed was a "horrible accident".
summary: A lawyer in the United States allegedly shot his 20-year-old son, burnt his body and then called the cops to tell them what he claimed was a "horrible accident".

title: "Not Our Fight": Trump Says US Shouldn't Get Involved In Syria Conflict
content: President-elect Donald Trump said on Saturday the US should not be involved in the conflict in Syria, where rebel forces are threatening the government of President Bashar al-Assad.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump said on Saturday the US should not be involved in the conflict in Syria, where rebel forces are threatening the government of President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Syrian President's Father's Statue In A Main Square Toppled By Protesters
content: Protesters brought down the statue of the late father of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad in a main square in Jermana suburb, nearly ten kilometers from the centre of Damascus.
summary: Protesters brought down the statue of the late father of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad in a main square in Jermana suburb, nearly ten kilometers from the centre of Damascus.

title: Charles De Gaulle's Famed World War II Speech On Show For First Time
content: One of the most famous speeches in modern French history -- General Charles de Gaulle's 1940 radio plea for France to resist the Nazi occupation -- is set to go on display on Saturday for the first time.
summary: One of the most famous speeches in modern French history -- General Charles de Gaulle's 1940 radio plea for France to resist the Nazi occupation -- is set to go on display on Saturday for the first time.

title: Syria Rebels Say Encircling Damascus As Government Denies Falling Back
content: Earlier, a war monitor and Abdel Ghani said rebels were within 20 kilometres of Damascus as government forces fall back in the face of the offensive gathering even more momentum.
summary: Earlier, a war monitor and Abdel Ghani said rebels were within 20 kilometres of Damascus as government forces fall back in the face of the offensive gathering even more momentum.

title: "Evade! Patriots Launched": Rare Audio Of Russian Jet Dodging US Missiles
content: Amid the ongoing war between Ukraine and Russia, a rare audio recording of a Russian fighter jet evading Ukraine's Patriot air defence missiles has surfaced on social media.
summary: Amid the ongoing war between Ukraine and Russia, a rare audio recording of a Russian fighter jet evading Ukraine's Patriot air defence missiles has surfaced on social media.

title: "Can Get Me Killed": US Man Falsely Linked To UnitedHealthcare CEO Murder
content: Quote-tweeting it, Mr Mannarino asked, "How is this allowed? This can get me killed," emphasising the potential consequences of such a mix-up.
summary: Quote-tweeting it, Mr Mannarino asked, "How is this allowed? This can get me killed," emphasising the potential consequences of such a mix-up.

title: Motion To Impeach South Korean President Who Imposed Martial Law Fails
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol escaped impeachment Saturday over his brief declaration of martial law, after lawmakers from his ruling party boycotted a vote despite huge protests outside parliament.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol escaped impeachment Saturday over his brief declaration of martial law, after lawmakers from his ruling party boycotted a vote despite huge protests outside parliament.

title: S Jaishankar Calls For Vigorous, Innovative, Participative Diplomacy
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the needle is moving towards the reality of negotiations rather than the continuation of the Russia-Ukraine war.
summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the needle is moving towards the reality of negotiations rather than the continuation of the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: Bangladesh Visa Rules Eased For Pakistanis, Sparks Concerns For India
content: Zia's party has historically kept closer ties with Pakistan unlike Sheikh Hasina's Awami League, who had kept a more pro-India stance. There is growing uncertainty about Bangladesh's new diplomatic and political outlook as well.
summary: Zia's party has historically kept closer ties with Pakistan unlike Sheikh Hasina's Awami League, who had kept a more pro-India stance. There is growing uncertainty about Bangladesh's new diplomatic and political outlook as well.

title: "Car Drove Away At High Speed": Explosion Hits Block Of Flats At The Hague
content: A three-storey apartment block in The Hague partially collapsed Saturday after a fire and explosion, firefighters said, with first responders searching for people under the rubble.
summary: A three-storey apartment block in The Hague partially collapsed Saturday after a fire and explosion, firefighters said, with first responders searching for people under the rubble.

title: Australian Woman Who Lost $1 Million In Scam Recalls Meeting Criminal
content: A woman in Australia who lost over a million in an elaborate scam eerily came face to face with one of the criminals while she was vacationing in China with her husband.
summary: A woman in Australia who lost over a million in an elaborate scam eerily came face to face with one of the criminals while she was vacationing in China with her husband.

title: TikTok's Future In The US: How Trump Could Impact It
content: With 170 million Americans using TikTok, this decision will sound the death knell for the app in one of its biggest markets.
summary: With 170 million Americans using TikTok, this decision will sound the death knell for the app in one of its biggest markets.

title: Watch: Birds React To 7.0 Earthquake In Northern California
content: Earthquake In Northern California: The webcam footage at the Sacramento complex shows waterfowl foraging and wading in a wetland.
summary: Earthquake In Northern California: The webcam footage at the Sacramento complex shows waterfowl foraging and wading in a wetland.
